case_vignette: A 33-year-old woman comes to the physician for week-long episodes of headaches that have occurred every four weeks for the last year. During these episodes she also has bouts of lower abdominal pain and breast tenderness. She is often irritable at these times. Her menses occur at regular 28-day intervals with moderate flow. Her last menstrual period was 3 weeks ago. She drinks two to five beers on social occasions and used to smoke a pack of cigarettes daily, but stopped 6 months ago. Her mother and sister have hypothyroidism. Physical examination shows no abnormalities. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing weekly episodes of headaches, lower abdominal pain, and breast tenderness. I also feel quite irritable during these times.
When during your menstrual cycle do these symptoms usually occur?
These symptoms occur every four weeks, typically about a week before my menstrual period starts.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I have been experiencing these symptoms for the last year.
Have you noticed any changes in the severity of your symptoms or their impact on your daily activities over this period?
No, the severity and impact on my daily activities have remained consistent over this period.
Final Diagnosis: Premenstrual Syndrome (PMS)
